Authors:
Alexandre Gonçalves dos Santos Silva-Filho, Dirce Leimi
Komura, Jean-Marc Moncalvo, Iuri Goulart Baseia, Felipe Wartchow
Title:
Rhodocybe fusipes (Entolomataceae) a new species from
Amazonian ‘terra-firme’ forest of Brazil
Keywords:
Agaricales, Basidiomycota, rDNA ITS, molecular phylogeny,
Neotropical fungi, taxonomy
Abstract:
Rhodocybe fusipes (Entolomataceae) is described as a new
taxon belonging to sect. Rufrobrunnea. The specimens were found in the
Amazon rain forest of Brazil, growing on soil, among litterfall. This
new species is morphologically characterized by its clitocyboid habit,
reddish orange pileus, close lamellae, fusiform stipe with radicant
base, globose to short ellipsoid basidiospores, absence of cystidia and
by a cutis-like pileipellis. The description is illustrated with
photographs and line-drawings of the basidiomata and main microscopic
features. Molecular data (nrITS) support the recognition of this new
species.
